summary: This is a formal U.S. Department of Justice request to French authorities for mutual legal assistance in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. It outlines the charges against Maxwell for her role in Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minors from 1994-1997, requests confidentiality, and seeks to interview a witness in France ahead of Maxwell's July 2021 trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central subject of the prosecution. Charged with conspiracy, transportation of minors, coercion and enticement, and perjury for her role in assisting Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary perpetrator of sexual abuse of minor girls from 1994-2005. His 2019 indictment and subsequent suicide are mentioned, and the investigation into his associates, including Maxwell, is ongoing.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring with and assisting Epstein in the recruitment, grooming, and sexual abuse of minor victims.
The document frames Epstein as the primary abuser of minors, with Maxwell acting as a facilitator who enticed victims and caused them to travel for the purpose of abuse.

events.title: Epstein Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with conspiracy to sexually traffic in minors and other crimes related to sexual abuse of minors.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested pursuant to the indictment and detained pending trial in New York.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide in his jail cell while detained pending trial.

events.title: Maxwell Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, transportation of minors, coercion and enticement, and perjury for her role in Epstein's abuse scheme.

events.title: Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested pursuant to the indictment and has been detained pending trial in New York since that date.

events.title: Scheduled Maxwell Trial
events.description: A trial date was set for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The U.S. is formally requesting France's assistance to interview a witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution, indicating the international scope of the investigation.
The document states the investigation into Epstein's criminal conduct continued after his death and revealed evidence of additional crimes by his associates, leading to Maxwell's indictment.
Maxwell is charged not only with facilitating abuse but also with providing false and perjurious statements under oath about her role.
The request emphasizes extreme confidentiality to prevent witness tampering, evidence destruction, or alerting other subjects of the investigation.
The alleged criminal period for Maxwell's involvement with Epstein is specified as from at least 1994 to at least 1997.
